Job Title: Data Scientist

Location: Madison, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
FUJIFILM Cellular Dynamics, Inc. is searching for a Bioinformatician to contribute to our life science and therapeutic research programs. FCDI is expanding the use of genomics and next generation sequencing throughout our research and development teams. In this role you will be responsible for statistical support to ongoing studies on the behavior and performance of our reprogrammed and differentiated cell lines in both life science and therapeutic settings. As a member of the Data Sciences team, and in this new role, you will develop robust analytical pipelines for analysis of a wide range of next generation sequencing data. Work closely with team members in deploying tools and analysis and apply cutting-edge Next Generation technologies such as RNASeq, whole genome sequencing, epigenetic analysis, proteomics, and others to solve important problems in human health.

FUJIFILM Cellular Dynamics is a leading developer and supplier of human cells used in drug discovery, toxicity testing, stem cell banking, and cell therapy development. We partner with innovators from around the world to combine biologically relevant human cells with the newest technologies to drive advancements in medicine and healthier living. Our technology can be used to create induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) from anyone followed by the powerful capability to develop into virtually any cell type in the human body. Our proprietary manufacturing systems result in inventoried iCell® products and donor-specific Custom Products in the quantity, quality, purity, and reproducibility required for drug and cell therapy development.

 External US 

Essential Responsibilities

 Perform data analysis (s/mi/mRNAseq, whole genome assembly, SNP, BisSeq, ChIPseq) with in-house and externally generated NGS data.  Assist FCDI and Fujifilm scientists in interpreting experimental results.  Manage in-house and publicly available data collections in support of these analyses.  Evaluate publicly available analysis methods for applicability to FCDI research goals.  Organize, script and document analyses to ensure reproducibility.  Ensure data and analysis integrity through self-directed review.  Support ongoing development projects in bioinformatics and data management.  Educate scientific staff on bioinformatics best practices and developments.  Develop new methods of analysis as needed.  Other job functions as assigned. 

Required Skills And Education

 Master’s degree in Bioinformatics, Biostatistics, Computer Science or related field of study, or bachelor’s degree in Bioinformatics, Biostatistics, Computer Science or related field of study + 2 years of relevant experience.  3 years of relevant professional experience in the field of computational biology with demonstrated achievements and progressive responsibilities.  Experience with computational biology tools and methods (BWA, GATK, Trinity, Bioconductor, Soap2, Galaxy, BLAST, others).  Programming experience (Perl, Python, R, bash).  Relational Database Experience (MySQL, MS SQL Server, Oracle, Postgres).  Unix/Linux experience including shell scripting, basic commands, and utilities.  Experience in proteomics, mass spec, and image analysis is considered a plus.  Strong communication skills and being organized.  Able to work at a computer for extended periods of time.  Able to work on-site in Madison, WI two to three days a week. 

EEO/AGENCY NOTES

Fujifilm is an equal opportunity employer to all, regardless of age, ancestry, color, disability (mental and physical), exercising the right to family care and medical leave, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religious creed, sex (includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), and sexual orientation, and any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Fujifilm about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at Fujifilm via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of Fujifilm, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by Fujifilm for this requisition and a valid agreement with Fujifilm is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the Fujifilm agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.
